title: The Cambridge Introduction to Francophone Literature
abstractText:
The project aims to provide a critical re-assessment of the very diverse range of francophone literature from around the world in the light of recent developments in postcolonial theory. Hitherto francophone literature has been regarded as an exotic offshoot of French literature. 
My study seeks to re-present francophone literature as a body of writing best approached from the point of view of pragmatics and will illustrate how non-metropolitan texts are central to emergent notions of literarily in a globalised world, while such categories as 'national literatures' may justifiably be viewed as of marginal importance.
findingsText: This project resulted in the publication of a book : 'The Cambridge Introduction to Francophone Literature', CUP, 2007. The award allowed me to investigate the global breadth of francophone writing and to demonstaret the underpinning cultural diversity of the literature as well as to explore through case studies the specific contributions of a wide range of francophone writers. My findings have been used mainly within an academic context by readers (colleagues and students) who are working in the field of francophone postcolonial literary studies. Education
